columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the log entry was generated.

columns.name: InsertId
columns.description: A unique identifier for the log entry used to prevent duplication.

columns.name: Severity
columns.description: The severity level of the log entry (e.g., INFO, WARNING, ERROR).

columns.name: ReceiveTimestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the log entry was received.

columns.name: JsonPayloadType
columns.description: The type identifier from the JSON payload '@type' field.

columns.name: JsonPayloadAccesses
columns.description: Access details extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadEventId
columns.description: The event identifier from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadLocationPrincipalEmployingEntity
columns.description: Principal employing entity location extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadLocationPrincipalOfficeCountry
columns.description: Principal office country location extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadLocationPrincipalPhysicalLocationCountry
columns.description: Principal physical location country extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadLogMode
columns.description: Log mode value extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadPrincipalJobTitle
columns.description: Principal job title extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadProduct
columns.description: Product name extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: JsonPayloadReason
columns.description: Reason or cause extracted from the JSON payload.

columns.name: OperationId
columns.description: The identifier of the operation from the operation JSON object.

columns.name: ResourceLabelsProjectId
columns.description: Project ID label extracted from the resource JSON object.

columns.name: ServiceName
columns.description: The name of the API service performing the operation. For example, 'compute.googleapis.com'.

columns.name: MethodName
columns.description: The name of the service method or operation. For API calls, this should be the name of the API method.

columns.name: GCPResourceName
columns.description: The resource or collection that is the target of the operation. The name is a scheme-less URI, not including the API service name.

columns.name: NumResponseItems
columns.description: The number of items returned from a list or query API method, if applicable.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The status of the overall operation.

columns.name: AuthenticationInfo
columns.description: Authentication information.

columns.name: AuthorizationInfo
columns.description: Authorization information. If there are multiple resources or permissions involved, then there is one AuthorizationInfo element for each {resource, permission} tuple.

columns.name: RequestMetadata
columns.description: Metadata about the operation.

columns.name: Request
columns.description: The operation request. This may not include all request parameters, such as those that are too large, privacy-sensitive, or duplicated elsewhere in the log record. It should never include user-generated data, such as file contents. When the JSON object represented here has a proto equivalent, the proto name will be indicated in the @type property.

columns.name: Response
columns.description: The operation response. This may not include all response elements, such as those that are too large, privacy-sensitive, or duplicated elsewhere in the log record. It should never include user-generated data, such as file contents. When the JSON object represented here has a proto equivalent, the proto name will be indicated in the @type property.

columns.name: Metadata
columns.description: Other service-specific data about the request, response, and other information associated with the current audited event.

columns.name: StatusMessage
columns.description: The message status of the overall operation.

columns.name: PrincipalEmail
columns.description: The email address of the authenticated user (or service account on behalf of third party principal) making the request. For third party identity callers, the principalSubject field is populated instead of this field. For privacy reasons, the principal email address is sometimes redacted.

columns.name: LogName
columns.description: Information including a suffix identifying the log sub-type (e.g., admin activity, system access, data access) and where in the hierarchy the request was made.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: The time the event described by the log entry occurred.

columns.name: ProjectId
columns.description: The identifier of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) project associated with this resource, such as "my-project".

columns.name: GCPResourceType
columns.description: The identifier of the type associated with this resource, such as 'pubsub_subscription'.

columns.name: Subscription
columns.description: A named resource representing the stream of messages from a single, specific topic, to be delivered to the subscribing application.

columns.name: ResourceLocation
columns.description: The resource location information.

columns.name: ResourceOriginalState
columns.description: The resource original state before mutation. Present only for operations which have successfully modified the targeted resource(s). In general, this field should contain all changed fields, except those that are already been included in request, response, metadata or serviceData fields. When the JSON object represented here has a proto equivalent, the proto name will be indicated in the @type property.

columns.name: ServiceData
columns.description: An object containing fields of an arbitrary type. An additional field "@type" contains a URI identifying the type. Example: { "id": 1234, "@type": "types.example.com/standard/id" }.
